==Events==
*[[356 BC]] &ndash; The [[Temple of Artemis]] in [[Ephesus]], one of the [[Wonders of the World|Seven Wonders of the World]], is destroyed by [[arson]].
* [[230]] &ndash; [[Pope Pontian]] succeeds [[Pope Urban I|Urban I]] as the eighteenth [[pope]].
* [[285]] &ndash; [[Diocletian]] appoints [[Maximian]] as [[Caesar (title)|Caesar]] and co-ruler.
* [[365]] &ndash; A [[tsunami]] devastates the city of [[Alexandria|Alexandria, Egypt]]. The tsunami was caused by the [[365 Crete earthquake|Crete earthquake]] estimated to be 8.0 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]]. 5,000 people perished in Alexandria, and 45,000 more died outside the city.
*[[1242]] &ndash; [[Battle of Taillebourg]] : [[Louis IX of France]] puts an end to the revolt of his vassals [[Henry III of England]] and [[Hugh X of Lusignan]].
*[[1403]] &ndash; [[Battle of Shrewsbury]]: King [[Henry IV of England]] defeats rebels to the north of the county town of [[Shropshire]], [[England]].
*[[1545]] &ndash; The first landing of [[France|French]] troops on the coast of the [[Isle of Wight]] during the [[French invasion of the Isle of Wight]].
*[[1568]] &ndash; [[Eighty Years' War]]: [[Battle of Jemmingen]] &ndash; [[Fernando Álvarez de Toledo, 3rd Duke of Alba|Fernando Álvarez de Toledo, Duke of Alva]] defeats [[Louis of Nassau]].
*[[1645]] &ndash; [[Qing Dynasty]] regent [[Dorgon]] issues an [[Queue (hairstyle)#Queue Order|edict]] ordering all [[Han Chinese]] men to shave their forehead and braid the rest of their hair into a queue identical to those of the [[Manchus]].
*[[1656]] &ndash; The [[Raid on Malaga (1656)|Raid on Malaga]] takes place during the [[Anglo-Spanish War (1654–60)|Anglo-Spanish War]].
*[[1718]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Passarowitz]] between the [[Ottoman Empire]], [[Austria]] and the [[Republic of Venice]] is signed.
*[[1774]] &ndash; [[Russo-Turkish War (1768–1774)]]: [[Russia]] and the Ottoman Empire sign the [[Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca]] ending the war.
*[[1831]] &ndash; Inauguration of [[Leopold I of Belgium]], first king of the [[Belgium|Belgians]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[First Battle of Bull Run]] &ndash; at [[Manassas, Virginia|Manassas Junction, Virginia]], the first major battle of the war begins and ends in a victory for the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] army.
*[[1865]] &ndash; In the market square of [[Springfield, Missouri]], [[Wild Bill Hickok]] [[Wild Bill Hickok – Davis Tutt shootout|shoots and kills]] [[Davis Tutt]] in what is regarded as the first western showdown.
*[[1873]] &ndash; At [[Adair, Iowa]], [[Jesse James]] and the [[James-Younger Gang]] pull off the first successful [[train robbery]] in the [[American Frontier|American Old West]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; After [[riot]]ing by [[Baltimore and Ohio Railroad]] workers and the [[Great Railroad Strike of 1877|deaths of nine rail workers]] at the hands of the [[Maryland]] militia, workers in [[Pittsburgh|Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]] stage a [[Secondary action|sympathy strike]] that is met with an assault by the state militia.
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[Willis Carrier]] creates the first air conditioner in [[Buffalo, New York]]
*[[1903]] &ndash; Battle of [[Ciudad Bolívar]], a victory of federal army of [[Juan Vicente Gómez]] over forces of general [[Nicolás Rolando]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Louis Rigolly]], a Frenchman, becomes the first man to break the {{convert|100|mph|0|abbr=on}} barrier on land. He drove a 15-liter [[Gobron-Brille]] in [[Ostend]], Belgium.
*[[1907]] &ndash; The passenger steamer [[SS Columbia (1880)|SS ''Columbia'']] collides with the steam schooner ''San Pedro'' off [[Shelter Cove, California]], causing the ''Columbia'' to sink killing 88 people.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The Crown council of [[Romania]] decides for the country to remain neutral in [[World War I]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; {{SMU|U-156||2}} shells [[Attack on Orleans|Nauset Beach, in Orleans, Massachusetts]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[Airship|dirigible]] ''[[Wingfoot Air Express crash|Wingfoot Air Express]]'' crashes into the Illinois Trust and Savings Building in [[Chicago|Chicago, Illinois]], killing 12 people.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Scopes Trial]]: In [[Dayton, Tennessee]], high school biology teacher [[John T. Scopes]] is found guilty of teaching [[evolution]] in class and fined $100.
*  1925   &ndash; Sir [[Malcolm Campbell]], father of [[Donald Campbell]], becomes the first man to break the {{convert|150|mph|0|abbr=on}} land barrier at [[Pendine Sands]] in [[Wales]]. He drove a [[Sunbeam (car company)|Sunbeam]] at a two-way average speed of {{convert|150.33|mph|0|abbr=on}}.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Guam (1944)|Battle of Guam]] &ndash; American troops land on [[Guam]] starting the battle. It would end on [[August 10]].
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[Claus von Stauffenberg]] and fellow conspirators are executed in [[Berlin|Berlin, Germany]] for the [[20 July plot|July 20 plot]] to assassinate [[Adolf Hitler]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] ratifies the [[North Atlantic Treaty]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[First Indochina War]]: The [[Geneva Conference (1954)|Geneva Conference]] partitions [[Vietnam]] into [[North Vietnam]] and [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; {{Ship|NS|Savannah}}, the first [[nuclear marine propulsion|nuclear-powered]] cargo-passenger ship, is [[ship naming and launching|launched]] as a showcase for [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]]'s "[[Atoms for Peace]]" initiative.
*  1959  &ndash; [[Pumpsie Green|Elijah Jerry "Pumpsie" Green]] becomes the first [[list of African-American firsts|African-American]] to play for the [[Boston Red Sox]], the last team to integrate. He came in as a [[pinch runner]] for [[Vic Wertz]] and stayed in as shortstop in a 2-1 loss to the [[Chicago White Sox]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Project Mercury|Mercury program]]: [[Mercury-Redstone 4]] Mission &ndash; [[Gus Grissom]] piloting'' [[Mercury-Redstone 4|Liberty Bell 7]]''  becomes the second American to go into space (in a suborbital mission).
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Space Race]]: [[Neil Armstrong]] and [[Buzz Aldrin|Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin]] become the first humans to walk on the [[Moon]], during the [[Apollo 11]] mission (July 20 in North America).
*[[1970]] &ndash; After 11 years of construction, the [[Aswan Dam|Aswan High Dam]] in [[Egypt]] is completed.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: [[Bloody Friday (1972)|Bloody Friday]] &ndash; the [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] detonate 22 bombs in central [[Belfast|Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom]] in the space of 80 minutes, killing 9 and injuring 130.
*[[1973]] &ndash; In the [[Lillehammer affair]] in [[Norway]], [[Israel]]i [[Mossad]] agents kill a waiter whom they mistakenly thought was involved in the 1972 [[Munich massacre|Munich Olympics Massacre]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Christopher Ewart-Biggs]], the [[United Kingdom|British]] ambassador to the [[Republic of Ireland]], is assassinated by the Provisional IRA.
*[[1977]] &ndash; The start of the four day long [[Libyan–Egyptian War]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; The [[Lowest temperature recorded on Earth|world's lowest temperature]] in an inhabited location is recorded at [[Vostok Station]], [[Antarctica]] at {{convert|-89.2|°C|°F}}.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Third Taiwan Strait Crisis]]: The [[People's Liberation Army]] begins firing missiles into the waters north of [[Taiwan]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; At the conclusion of a fireworks display on Okura Beach in [[Akashi, Hyōgo]], Japan, [[Akashi pedestrian bridge accident|11 people are killed and more than 120 are injured]] when a pedestrian footbridge connecting the beach to JR [[Asagiri (train)|Asagiri]] railway station becomes overcrowded and people leaving the event fall down in a domino effect.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[21 July 2005 London bombings|Four terrorist bombings]], occurring exactly two weeks after the similar [[7 July 2005 London bombings|July 7 bombings]], target London's public transportation system. All four bombs fail to detonate and all four suspected suicide bombers are captured and later convicted and imprisoned for long terms.
*[[2007]] &ndash; ''[[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows]]'', the fastest-selling novel ever is published. It sold 15 million copies in the first 24 hours of its release.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[NASA]]'s [[Space Shuttle program]] ends with the landing of [[Space Shuttle Atlantis]] on mission [[STS-135]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Erden Eruç]] completes the first solo human-powered circumnavigation of the world.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Philippe of Belgium]] becomes [[King of the Belgians]]
